intro: Trigonostemon apetalogyne, commonly known as the leafy hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
